Success](https://web.njit.edu/~rt494/security/)
- {{< iconify fa6-solid book-open size=18px >}} High-level overview of
[Cracking Codes with Python](https://inventwithpython.com/cracking/)

[Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces](https://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~remzi/OSTEP/)

## Activities

- {{< iconify fa6-solid diagram-project size=18px >}} **Monday**: No laboratory
  session
- {{< iconify fa6-solid people-line size=18px >}} **Tuesday and Thursday**: Course introduction
  - Continued introduction to the computer security course
  - Continued highlighting of the concept of a "security synapse"
  - Introduction to basic computer security concepts and principles
  - Student presentations that feature:
    - Explanation of a high-level concept in the field of computer security
    - In-class activity that connects concepts to real-world scenarios
    - Implementation of a security concept in two programming languages
    - Question and answer session with learning peers and the course instructor
